result.execSummary:
Ryan Sheldon was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Ryan Sheldon was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Sheldon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 14CF155 Called 3:40 p.m. Ryan Sheldon appears in person and in custody from FC jail. Mary Burns appears via telephone. No other appearances. Extradition hearing - Sheldon was not aware of warrant from Iron County. Court - Burns has advised Sheldon of the extradition and process. Court advises Sheldon of right to attorney, right to challenge, extradition and warrant. Sheldon - request to speak with attorney. Court recesses 3:45 pm Court re-calls case 3:49 p.m. Same appearances. Sheldon would like to waive his right to an extradition hearing. Court goes through waiver of consent to extradition and defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to extradition. Court grants waiver and signs paperwork. Clerk supplies defendant with copies of paperwork.
